text: Zea is a Canadian short film, directed by André Leduc and Jean-Jacques Leduc and released in 1981."Première du film «Zea»". Bilan du siècle. Set to a recording of the Ralph Vaughan Williams composition "Fantasia on a Theme by Thomas Tallis", the five-minute film presents a close-up depiction of a kernel of corn slowly heating up in oil until it bursts into popcorn.Jeff Lenburg, Who's who in Animated Cartoons: An International Guide to Film & Television's Award-winning and Legendary Animators. Hal Leonard Books, 2006. . Entry "Leduc, André", p. 206. The film was screened at the 1981 Cannes Film Festival, where it was co-winner of the Jury Prize in the Short Film Competition. It won the Genie Award for Best Theatrical Short Film at the 3rd Genie Awards in 1982.Maria Topalovich, And the Genie Goes To...: Celebrating 50 Years of the Canadian Film Awards.
